question.title: Browser is not maximizing in the headless mode
question.body:
I'm facing a problem while running the automation suite using Java + Selenium in headless mode. The scripts are failing because the browser is not maximizing as expected.

My current Chrome version is 137.0.7151.120.

If anyone has come across this issue or knows a reliable solution/workaround, please share your inputs. Any help is appreciated!

I tried with the below code, but still not getting any solution:

ChromeOptions options = new ChromeOptions();
options.addArguments("--headless=new");
options.addArguments("--window-size=1920,1080");                
options.addArguments("--no-sandbox"); 
options.addArguments("--disable-dev-shm-usage");                 
// options.addArguments("--disable-gpu"); 
WebDriverManager.chromedriver().setup();
driver = new ChromeDriver(options);
DriverManager.setDriver(driver);

answers.body:
Can you trying using one of these flags while starting the browser?

--start-maximized   Starts the browser maximized, regardless of any previous settings.

or

--start-fullscreen  Specifies if the browser should start in fullscreen mode, like if the user had pressed F11 right after startup.

More Info:

  • https://peter.sh/experiments/chromium-command-line-switches/#start-maximized

By commenting the line DriverManager.getDriver().manage().window().maximize(); in my browser calling function, browser is maximised.

My headless code is mentioned in my question.

This is due to a change in Chrome: https://issues.chromium.org/issues/423334494

When using headless mode, set window size with:

options.addArguments("--screen-info={0,0 1920x1080}");

"Starting with m135 Chrome Headless Mode on Linux (m136 on Windows and m138 on Macs) stopped using physical screen parameters as the basis for UI geometry calculations. Instead, it uses a virtual 800x600 headless screen that is completely independent of any physical screen attached to the system the Headless Chrome is running on. The --window-size switch now only defines the initial browser window size, and not the headless screen size as it was before with Chrome Headless Shell.

The new --screen-info switch can be used to define the headless screen display parameters, including multi screen configurations."

question_comments.body: What does "maximize" even mean in headless mode?
